sanskrit_verse:
मार्जारनकुलौ हत्वा चाषं मण्डूकमेव च ।
श्वगोधौलूककाकांश्च शूद्रहत्याव्रतं चरेत् ॥ ११.१३१॥
transliteration:
mārjāranakulau hatvā cāṣaṃ maṇḍūkameva ca |
śvagodhau lūkakākāṃśca śūdrahatyāvrataṃ caret || 11.131||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who kills a cat, mongoose, crow, frog, lizard, owl, or dog must perform the expiation prescribed for killing a Śūdra.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: The act of taking life invokes responsibility regardless of species, based on conscious intent.
Causation: The causal chain initiated by intentional killing demands restorative completion.
Capacity-based responsibility: The perpetrator's capacity to discern right from wrong establishes their obligation to restore balance.
Restoration logic: Expiation serves not as punishment but as a mechanism to realign the consciousness of the actor with universal Dharma.
Consciousness alignment: The prescribed ritual restores harmony between individual awareness and cosmic order.
executable_legal_axioms: IF (intentional killing occurs) AND (target is non-human life-form listed: cat, mongoose, crow, frog, lizard, owl, dog) THEN (assign śūdrahattyā vrata as corrective action)
IF (perpetrator demonstrates intent) AND (act results in death of specified beings) THEN (initiate consciousness-restoration protocol via prescribed vrata)
IF (community reports violation) AND (evidence confirms intentional harm) THEN (trigger automatic assignment of expiatory practice)
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that intent and species-specific valuation do not diminish the gravity of causing death. Responsibility lies in the disruption of life-force (prāṇa), requiring immediate initiation of consciousness-realigning measures rather than punitive sanctions.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that all life carries energetic integrity; destruction necessitates restitution through vrata. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how imbalance propagates unless corrected. Responsibility aligns proportionally with awareness at time of act. Non-punitivity is upheld because correction operates at the level of consciousness, not consequence infliction.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate śūdrahattyā vrata under guidance of qualified spiritual authority
Assign daily recitation and offering rituals until inner equilibrium is restored
Engage perpetrator in service-oriented practices to rebuild respect for life-energy
Monitor progress through bi-weekly self-assessment aligned with scriptural benchmarks
final_declaration: By the Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of Dharma, this law stands executed. Killing disrupts universal flow; expiation restores it. There is no punishment—only realignment. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
